title: OpenMPI fails to find OpenFabrics
body:
### Expected Result

I expected that the openMPI I installed with spack would be able to build and run MPI hello world with no error messages.

### Actual Result

``` console
> mpiexec -n 4 ./hello_world
--------------------------------
[[32506,1],1]: A high-performance Open MPI point-to-point messaging module
was unable to find any relevant network interfaces:

Module: OpenFabrics (openib)
  Host: [hostname]

Another transport will be used instead, although this may result in
lower performance.

Note: You can disable this warning by setting the MCA parameter
btl_base_warn_component_unused to 0.
--------------------------------
Hello world!
Hello world!
Hello world!
Hello world!
[[hostname]:36270] 3 more processes have sent help message help-mpi-btl-base.txt / btl:no-nics
[[hostname]:36270] Set MCA parameter "orte_base_help_aggregate" to 0 to see all help / error messages
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Here's my hello_world.c:
``` c
#include <mpi.h>
#include <stdio.h>

int main() {
  MPI_Init(NULL, NULL);
  printf("Hello world!\n");
  MPI_Finalize();
}
```

Load the spack openmpi module.  According to spack find --variants openmpi:
```
openmpi@3.0.0~cude fabrics=verbs ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple~ucx+vt
```
I don't know much about installing MPI, so it's entirely possible that I should have selected a different variant.  All of its dependencies (including gcc@7.1.0) were built with spack.

```console
> mpicc -o hello_world hello_world.c
> mpiexec -n 4 ./hello_world
```

### Information on your system

My machine is identified as linux-suse_linux11-x86-64.  Please let me know if you need more details about it.
